job_title: Regional Catering Manager in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros: Friendly staff and friendly place to work,
cons: Long hours, but has its advantages

pros: The people are fantasic as is the social misson. Head office is great (except for the parking!)
cons: Not great at listening to staff

pros:
Lots of opportunities for sideways transitions between the groups various brands.

Decent Health insurance with Westfield Health.

Huge on diversity and inclusion. HR will listen and support you as much as they can.

If you are looking for a short-term role, it's a great place to be. But it is unlikely you will remain there for the long term.
cons:
At the moment budgets are frozen, as the company gets dangerously close to breaching their loan covenant. This means we are only carrying out emergency repairs on homes, resulting in LOTS of customer complaints as day-to-day repairs are not being seen to.

Senior management are too far removed from the customer group, to truly understand the work environment for their employees.

Limited opportunity for upward progression.

review_title: Life as a drone in the hive
pros:
Free parking
Good working hours
Good training and work based qualifications
Decent work unit/ office facilities 
Good holiday allowance 
Good work/life balance
M.D appeared genuine and passionate in their leadership.
cons:
Corporate Company/office language becomes tedious
Very p.c
Sometimes a little patronising from the management down
Personally felt as though I was pretending to be someone I probably wasn't to fit into the 'honeycomb' culture.

job_title: Business Intelligence Analyst in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros: Honeycomb Group is an excellent place to work, the work is varied and interesting and my colleagues are good to work with. They are also very flexible with working arrangements and there are opportunities for development. Best place I've worked so far!
cons: As a non profit salaries aren't always the highest, but the working arrangements, good development opportunities and nice working environment help to make up for this

pros:
Friendly staff
Hybrid working
Reasonable salary 
Pension, holidays, working hours 
Reasonable workload
cons:
No room for manoeuvre with salaries, they are not banded - though this is the nature of non-profit. 
Some roles appear significantly more stressful than others.

pros:
Friendly work colleagues
Great place to work
New ICT facilities
cons: None found yet but so far so good

job_title: Safe & Well Coach in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros: Interesting co. of like minded & determined staff.
cons: Like the majority of charities; tasked with the enormity of government work (probably underfunded;-;)

job_title: Tenancy Support Practitioner in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros:
True to their ethos and values of having a social heart and business mind-this transfers seamlessly into the workforce and staff are treated with respect and as individuals with individual needs, within the work place,Honeycomb group always promoting a work life balance, i believe they are a company who genuinely care about staff well-being and all round happiness. Great supporter of CPD and actively encourage training and self improvement.
Management do not operate a hierarchy which is refreshing.
cons: Sometimes managers and leaders are caught up in the moment and cannot give instant support,but there is a way to book a 'check in' with managers to resolve any issues. Other staff(Any department)are always on hand to support and no question is deemed 'silly' so when seeking out answers  to questions and queries someone will always help or know someone to direct you to.

job_title: Customer Service Advisor in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros:
- Approachable staff, from reception to the CEO and Directors.
- A genuine concern for the wellbeing of staff.
- An innovative development programme, one in which you are in complete control of.
- Knowing that people are benefiting from your work.
- The company has recently re-branded and the  services are clearer than ever before and easier on the eye.
- People are the heart of the group
- Ongoing upgrading  hardware and software.
- 35 Hours per week, giving staff a great work-life balance.
cons: Perhaps the role of Senior Customer Service Advisor is undervalued, because the role is that of a team leader but without the title.

pros: The staff here are so good to work with, supportive and innovative and always trying to give the best customer experience, support and attention in improving customers situations/lives as much as they can do.  The staff and managers also support and encourage each other, there is no hierarchy, there is respect for each other and also a passion for the work we each do.  My experience so far has been brilliant - such a great place to work and grow.  The company definitely value and appreciate each and every staff member.
cons: I don't have any that I can think of.

review_title: Great place to work! A real breath of fresh air!
job_title: Apprentice (Degree) Development Project Manager in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros: It is a great place to work, everyone is so welcoming and talkative, and you will always be set up to do your best, you can tell that they want you in there company, and have no intentions of setting you up to fail. I feel welcomed to the group everyday, with multiple different opportunities each day. No day is the same.
cons: At this moment, within my few weeks here, I cannot find any negatives about working here.

job_title: Landlord Liaison Officer in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros: Absolutely love working for this organisation, no two days are the same and the passion that everyone demonstrates is really inspiring. I have met some great people since working here and everyone is always happy to help with any problems that I have faced.
cons: When I first started I felt that there could have been a bit more direction given and a little more training in order for me to thrive in my role as much as possible in the future.

review_title: I wouldn't want to work anywhere else
job_title: Marketing Communications Assistant in Stoke-on-Trent, England
pros:
- Flexible
- Great employee benefits
- Competitive Salary
- Great work/life balance
- Made to feel welcome by everyone including, senior management
- All the support you need to settle in and continue with professional development
- An open and honest organisation, able to discuss any concerns or issues with ease and without judgment
- Smooth recruitment process
cons: It would be great if there was more parking available.

pros:
Working with an excellent friendly team that go above and beyond to help me with anything and make me feel comfortable being new here. 
Everyone I have met has been friendly and wonderful towards me. I wake up looking forward to coming to work rather than dreading it and altogether has made me alot happier since joining the Honeycombe Group!
cons: Havent met all the residents yet

pros: Great company to work for. Look after their staff. Great ethics for both customers and staff. Nice working environment. Makes going to work enjoyable
cons: Workload is often heavy due to staff levels

review_title: Excellent organisation with positive staff and community feel
pros: Excellent working culture, very nice office facilities, reasonable pay and you feel very valued by managament
cons: No parking at main office

pros: Working environment was amazing, people care within the team, and learnt so much over the last few years.
